title.value: Источники устойчивости томатов (род Lycopersicon) к возбудителям хозяйственно-значимых заболеваний
Sources of tomato (genus Lycopersicon) resistance to agents of economically significant diseases

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Tarutina, L.A., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Genetics and Cytology

abstract.value: The main goal of the research appears identification with the help of molecular markers the forms of tomatoes, able to be the donors of the features of the resistance to different plant diseases. The breeding material, including cultivated forms and wild species of tomato, for the presence of genes of resistance to tomato spotted wilt virus, tomato mosaic virus, root nematode (Meloidogyne incognita) and fusarium wilt are studied. The examples, used for the experiment are enumerated; the primers, taken for identification of the resistance features, are analyzed. DNA fragments of the locus Tm2 of the F1/06-3 line are displayed. PCR-fragments, appearing as a result of primer amplification, are presented. It is shown that six tomato lines carry I-2 allele (confer resistance to fusarium wilt), three lines carry Sw5-b allele (confer resistance to spotted wilt virus resistance gene), and one each sample carry Tm2 (confer resistance to tomato mosaic virus) and Mi-1 (confer resistance to root nematode) alleles. These forms can be used as donors for introgression of the resistance traits to relevant pathogen into modern varieties of tomato of Belarusian selection.
